Items.Name: TM01
Items.Description: Powerful, but makes the user flinch if hit by foe.

Items.Name: TM02
Items.Description: Hooks and slashes the foe with long, sharp claws.

Items.Name: TM03
Items.Description: Generates an ultrasonic wave that may confuse.

Items.Name: TM04
Items.Description: Raises SP. ATK and SP. DEF by focusing the mind.
Items.Location: Prize for defeating Tate and Liza

Items.Name: TM05
Items.Description: A savage roar that makes the foe flee to end the battle.

Items.Name: TM06
Items.Description: Poisons the foe with a toxin that gradually worsens.

Items.Name: TM07
Items.Description: Creates a hailstorm that damages all types except Ice.

Items.Name: TM08
Items.Description: Bulks up the body to boost both ATTACK & Defense.

Items.Name: TM09
Items.Description: Shoots 2 to 5 seeds in a row to strike the foe.

Items.Name: TM10
Items.Description: The attack power varies among different Pokémon.

Items.Name: TM11
Items.Description: Raises the power of FIRE-type moves for 5 turns.

Items.Name: TM12
Items.Description: Enrages the foe so it can only use attack moves.

Items.Name: TM13
Items.Description: Fires an icy cold beam that may freeze the foe.

Items.Name: TM14
Items.Description: A brutal snow-and-wind attack that may freeze the foe.

Items.Name: TM16
Items.Description: Creates a wall of light that lowers SP. ATK damage.

Items.Name: TM17
Items.Description: Negates all damage, but may fail if used in succession.

Items.Name: TM18
Items.Description: Raises the power of WATER-type moves for 5 turns.

Items.Name: TM19
Items.Description: Recovers half the HP of the damage this move inflicts.

Items.Name: TM20
Items.Description: Prevents status abnormality with a mystical power.

Items.Name: TM21
Items.Description: The less the user likes you, the more powerful this move.

Items.Name: TM22
Items.Description: Absorbs sunlight in the 1st turn, then attacks next turn.

Items.Name: TM23
Items.Description: Slams the foe with a hard tail. It may lower Defense.

Items.Name: TM24
Items.Description: A powerful electric attack that may cause paralysis.
Items.Location: Gift from Wattson after New Mauville quest, Mauville Game Corner

Items.Name: TM25
Items.Description: Strikes the foe with thunderbolt. It may paralyze.

Items.Name: TM26
Items.Description: Causes a quake that has no effect on flying foes.

Items.Name: TM27
Items.Description: The more the user likes you, the more powerful this move.

Items.Name: TM28
Items.Description: Digs underground the 1st turn, then strikes next turn.

Items.Name: TM29
Items.Description: A powerful psychic attack that may lower Sp. Def.

Items.Name: TM30
Items.Description: Hurls a dark lump at the foe. It may lower Sp. Def.

Items.Name: TM31
Items.Description: Destroys barriers like Light Screen and causes damage.

Items.Name: TM32
Items.Description: Creates illusionary copies to enhance elusiveness.

Items.Name: TM33
Items.Description: Creates a wall of light that weakens physical attacks.

Items.Name: TM34
Items.Description: Zaps the foe with a jolt of electricity that never misses.

Items.Name: TM35
Items.Description: Looses a stream of fire that may burn the foe.

Items.Name: TM36
Items.Description: Hurls sludge at the foe. It may poison the foe.

Items.Name: TM37
Items.Description: Causes a sandstorm that hits the foe over several turns.

Items.Name: TM38
Items.Description: A powerful fire attack that may burn the foe.

Items.Name: TM39
Items.Description: Stops the foe from moving with rocks. May lower Speed.

Items.Name: TM40
Items.Description: An extremely fast attack that can't be avoided.

Items.Name: TM41
Items.Description: Prevents the foe from using the same move in a row.

Items.Name: TM42
Items.Description: Creates a wall of light that weakens physical attacks.

Items.Name: TM43
Items.Description: Adds an effect to attack depending on the location.

Items.Name: TM44
Items.Description: The user sleeps for 2 turns to restore health and status.

Items.Name: TM45
Items.Description: Makes it tough to attack a foe of the opposite gender.

Items.Name: TM46
Items.Description: While attacking, it may steal the foe's held item.

Items.Name: TM47
Items.Description: Spreads hard-edged wings and slams into the foe.

Items.Name: TM48
Items.Description: Switches abilities with the foe on the turn this is used.

Items.Name: TM49
Items.Description: Steals the effects of the move the foe is trying to use.

Items.Name: TM50
Items.Description: Enables full-power attack, but sharply lowers the Sp. Atk.

Items.Name: Coin Case
Items.Description: A case that holds up to 9,999 Coins.
Items.Location: Received from the woman in the house next to Mauville City's Poké Mart in exchange for Harbor Mail.

Items.Name: Good Rod
Items.Description: A decent fishing rod for catching wild Pokémon.
Items.Location: Received from the fisherman on the right side of the river on Route 118.

Items.Name: Itemfinder
Items.Description: A device that signals an invisible item by sound.
Items.Location: Reward from Brendan or May after defeating him/her on Route 110.

Items.Name: Meteorite
Items.Description: A meteorite found at Meteor Falls.
Items.Location: At Mt. Chimney, inside the machine next to where the player fights Maxie.

Items.Name: Old Rod
Items.Description: Use by any body of water to fish for wild Pokémon.
Items.Location: Received from the fisherman just south of the pier in Dewford Town.

Items.Name: S.S. Ticket
Items.Description: The ticket required for sailing on a ferry.
Items.Location: Received from Norman in Littleroot Town after defeating the Elite Four.

Items.Name: Super Rod
Items.Description: The best fishing rod for catching wild Pokémon.
Items.Location: Received from the fisherman inside the northernmost house of Mossdeep City.

Items.Name: Acro Bike
Items.Description: A folding bicycle capable of jumps and wheelies.
Items.Location: At Rydel's Cycles in Mauville City.

Items.Name: Basement Key
Items.Description: The key for New Mauville beneath Mauville City.
Items.Location: Received from Wattson for agreeing to help fix New Mauville's generator.

Items.Name: Claw Fossil
Items.Description: A fossil of an ancient, seafloor-dwelling Pokémon.

Items.Name: Devon Goods
Items.Description: A package that contains Devon's machine parts.
Items.Location: Taken from the Team Aqua Grunt inside Rusturf Tunnel after defeating him.

Items.Name: Devon Scope
Items.Description: A device by Devon that signals any unseeable Pokémon.
Items.Location: Gift from Steven on the wooden bridge on Route 120.

Items.Name: Eon Ticket
Items.Description: The ticket for a ferry to a distant southern island.

Items.Name: Go-Goggles
Items.Description: Nifty goggles that protect eyes from desert sandstorms.
Items.Location: Gift from Brendan or May after defeating Flannery.

Items.Name: Letter
Items.Description: A letter to Steven from the President of the Devon Corp.
Items.Location: Received from Mr. Stone in his office at Devon Corporation headquarters after retrieving the Devon Goods.

Items.Name: Mach Bike
Items.Description: A folding bicycle that doubles your speed or better.
Items.Location: At Rydel's Cycles in Mauville City.

Items.Name: Pokéblock Case

Items.Location: The Contest Hall in Lilycove City.

Items.Description: A key that opens a door inside the Abandoned Ship.

Items.Description: A device found inside the Abandoned Ship.

Items.Name: Soot Sack
Items.Description: A sack used to gather and hold volcanic ash.

Items.Name: Storage Key
Items.Description: The key to the storage inside the Abandoned Ship.

Items.Name: AuroraTicket
Items.Description: A ticket required to board the ship to Birth Island.

Items.Name: MysticTicket
Items.Description: A ticket required to board the ship to Navel Rock.

Items.Name: Powder Jar
Items.Description: Stores Berry Powder made using a Berry Crusher.
Items.Location: Received from a woman in the upper-right stall of Slateport City's Market.

Items.Name: Cheri Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that heals paralysis in battle.
Items.TagDescription: Blooms with delicate pretty flowers. The bright red Berry is very spicy.

Items.Name: Chesto Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that awakens Pokémon in battle.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry's thick skin and fruit are very tough. It is dry-tasting all over.

Items.Name: Pecha Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that heals poisoning in battle.
Items.TagDescription: Very sweet and delicious. Also very tender - handle with care.

Items.Name: Rawst Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that heals a burn in battle.
Items.TagDescription: If the leaves grow long and curly, the Berry seems to grow very bitter.

Items.Name: Aspear Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that defrosts Pokémon in battle.
Items.TagDescription: The hard Berry is dense with a rich juice. It is quite sour.

Items.Name: Leppa Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that awakens Pokémon in battle.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry's thick skin and fruit are very tough. It is dry-tasting all over.

Items.Name: Oran Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that restores 10 HP in battle.
Items.TagDescription: A peculiar Berry with a mix of flavours. Berries grow in half a day.

Items.Name: Persim Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that heals confusion in battle.
Items.TagDescription: Loves sunlight. The Berry's color grows vivid when exposed to the sun.

Items.Name: Lum Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that heals any status problem in battle.
Items.TagDescription: Slow to grow. If raised with loving care, it may grow two Berries.

Items.Name: Sitrus Berry
Items.Description: A hold item that restores 30 HP in battle.
Items.TagDescription: Closely related to Oran. The large Berry has a well-rounded flavour.

Items.Name: Figy Berry
Items.Effect: USE HEAL 12.5%;USE CAUSE CONFUSION IF DISLIKE SPICY
Items.Description: A hold item that restores HP but may confuse.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry, which looks chewed up, brims with spicy substances.

Items.Name: Wiki Berry
Items.Effect: USE HEAL 12.5%;USE CAUSE CONFUSION IF DISLIKE DRY
Items.Description: A hold item that restores HP but may confuse.
Items.TagDescription: This Berry is said to have grown lumpy to help Pokémon grip it.

Items.Name: Mago Berry
Items.Effect: USE HEAL 12.5%;USE CAUSE CONFUSION IF DISLIKE SWEET
Items.Description: A hold item that restores HP but may confuse.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry turns curvy as it grows. The curvier, the sweeter and tastier.

Items.Name: Aguav Berry
Items.Effect: USE HEAL 12.5%;USE CAUSE CONFUSION IF DISLIKE BITTER
Items.Description: A hold item that restores HP but may confuse.
Items.TagDescription: The flower is dainty. It is rare in its ability to grow without light.

Items.Name: Iapapa Berry
Items.Effect: USE HEAL 12.5%;USE CAUSE CONFUSION IF DISLIKE SOUR
Items.Description: A hold item that restores HP but may confuse.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry is very big and sour. It takes at least a day to grow.

Items.Name: Razz Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Razz.
Items.TagDescription: The red Berry tastes slightly spicy. It grows quickly in just four hours.

Items.Name: Bluk Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Bluk.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry is blue on the outside, but it blackens the mouth when eaten.

Items.Name: Nanab Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Nanab.
Items.TagDescription: This Berry was the seventh discovered in the world. It is sweet.

Items.Name: Wepear Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Wepear.
Items.TagDescription: The flower is small and white. It has a delicate balance of bitter and sour.

Items.Name: Pinap Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Pinap.
Items.TagDescription: Weak against wind and cold. The fruit is spicy and the skin, sour.

Items.Name: Pomeg Berry
Items.Description: Makes a Pokémon friendly but lowers base HP.
Items.TagDescription: However much it is watered, it only grows up to six Berries.

Items.Name: Kelpsy Berry
Items.Description: Makes a Pokémon friendly but lowers base Attack.
Items.TagDescription: A rare variety shaped like a root. Grows a very large flower.

Items.Name: Qualot Berry
Items.Description: Makes a Pokémon friendly but lowers base Defense.
Items.TagDescription: Loves water. Grows strong even in locations with constant rainfall.

Items.Name: Hondew Berry
Items.Description: Makes a Pokémon friendly but lowers base Sp. Atk.
Items.TagDescription: A Berry that is very valuable and rarely seen. It is very delicious.

Items.Name: Grepa Berry
Items.Description: Makes a Pokémon friendly but lowers base Sp. Def.
Items.TagDescription: Despite its tenderness and round shape, the Berry is unimaginably sour.

Items.Name: Tamato Berry
Items.Description: Makes a Pokémon friendly but lowers base Speed.
Items.TagDescription: The Berry is lip-bendingly spicy. It takes time to grow.

Items.Name: Cornn Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Cornn.
Items.TagDescription: A Berry from an ancient era. May not grow unless planted in quantity.

Items.Name: Magost Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Magost.
Items.TagDescription: A Berry that is widely said to have a finely balanced flavour.

Items.Name: Rabuta Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Rabuta.
Items.TagDescription: A rare variety that is overgrown with hair. It is quite bitter.

Items.Name: Nomel Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Nomel.
Items.TagDescription: Quite sour. Just one bite makes it impossible to taste for three days.

Items.Name: Spelon Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Spelon.
Items.TagDescription: The vividly red Berry is very spicy. Its warts secrete a spicy substance.

Items.Name: Pamtre Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Pamtre.
Items.TagDescription: Drifts on the sea from somewhere. It is thought to grow elsewhere.

Items.Name: Watmel Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Watmel.
Items.TagDescription: A huge Berry with some over 20 inches discovered. Exceedingly sweet.

Items.Name: Durin Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Durin.
Items.TagDescription: Bitter to even look at. It is so bitter, no one has ever eaten it as is.

Items.Name: Belue Berry
Items.Description: POKé Block ingredient. Plant in loamy soil to grow Belue.
Items.TagDescription: It is glossy and looks delicious, but it is awfully sour. Takes time to grow.
